citations.narrative:
One young male red kangaroo is currently not in its primary enclosure but is still contained within the property's perimeter
fence. The facility reports that while moving the kangaroos, one young one jumped over the fencing panel and ran off to
another area of the property. The facility has consulted with their attending veterinarian and has tried to get close to it but
hasn't had success in capturing it so that it can be moved to the primary enclosure with the others. Handling methods that
allow an animal to get away from primary enclosures and the necessary process of recapturing can cause behavioral
stress to the animal. Ensure to improve methods of moving kangaroos to prevent this type of incident and work closely
with the attending veterinarian on recapturing the young kangaroo without causing it unnecessary behavioral stress.
***Correct from 11/12/2024 forward.

The primary enclosures for the Moluccan cockatoos and hybrid macaw had some loose wire and wire points that the birds
could contact. Loose wire and wire points could cause injury. Ensure the enclosures are maintained in good repair to
prevent risk of injury.
***Correct by 11/13/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
One young male red kangaroo is currently not in its primary enclosure but is still contained within the property's perimeter 
fence. The facility reports that while moving the kangaroos, one young one jumped over the fencing panel and ran off to 
another area of the property. The facility has consulted with their attending veterinarian and has tried to get close to it but 
hasn't had success in capturing it so that it can be moved to the primary enclosure with the others. Handling methods that 
allow an animal to get away from primary enclosures and the necessary process of recapturing can cause behavioral 
stress to the animal. Ensure to improve methods of moving kangaroos to prevent this type of incident and work closely 
with the attending veterinarian on recapturing the young kangaroo without causing it unnecessary behavioral stress. 
***Correct from 11/12/2024 forward. 
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The primary enclosures for the Moluccan cockatoos and hybrid macaw had some loose wire and wire points that the birds 
could contact. Loose wire and wire points could cause injury. Ensure the enclosures are maintained in good repair to 
prevent risk of injury. 
***Correct by 11/13/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
